question: [File: aptos-core/config/src/config/safety_rules_config.rs] [Function: set_data_dir()] [OnDiskStorage validation] Does set_data_dir() validate that the OnDiskStorage backend has proper access controls preventing other users from reading validator keys? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/safety_rules_config.rs] [Field: logger] [Log injection] Can malicious configuration values be injected through logger config (line 28) causing log poisoning attacks that hide consensus violations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/safety_rules_config.rs] [Field: logger] [Sensitive data logging] Does LoggerConfig accidentally log sensitive safety rules data like consensus keys, votes, or internal state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/safety_rules_config.rs] [Field: logger] [Log file permissions] Can LoggerConfig write to world-readable log files exposing safety rules internal state to unauthorized processes? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/safety_rules_config.rs] [Type: WaypointConfig] [Waypoint validation] Does WaypointConfig validate that waypoints correspond to actual committed ledger states, or can arbitrary waypoints be injected? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/safety_rules_config.rs] [Function: waypoint()] [Waypoint freshness] Does waypoint() check that the waypoint is recent and not from an old epoch that could allow fork attacks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/safety_rules_config.rs] [Type: WaypointConfig] [Multiple waypoint sources] Can different parts of the config specify conflicting waypoints causing validators to operate on different chain views? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/safety_rules_config.rs] [Type: IdentityBlob] [Blob validation] Does IdentityBlob::from_file() validate blob integrity, version compatibility, and cryptographic signatures before loading validator identity? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/safety_rules_config.rs] [Function: identity_blob()] [Blob tampering] Can identity blobs be modified in-transit or on-disk without detection, allowing attackers to inject malicious validator identities? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/safety_rules_config.rs] [Function: overriding_identity_blobs()] [Override priority] When multiple overriding identity blobs are loaded, which one takes precedence, and can attackers exploit this to prioritize malicious keys? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/safety_rules_config.rs] [Type: IdentityBlob] [Blob format attacks] Can specially crafted identity blob file formats exploit parsing vulnerabilities causing buffer overflows or code execution? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/safety_rules_config.rs] [Type: ConfigKey<bls12381::PrivateKey>] [Key serialization] Does ConfigKey properly protect BLS private keys during serialization, or can keys leak through debug output or insecure serialization? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/safety_rules_config.rs] [Function: consensus_key()] [Key storage] When consensus_key is set (line 259), is the private key immediately zeroized from memory after copying to prevent key recovery from memory dumps? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/safety_rules_config.rs] [Type: ConfigKey] [Key lifetime] Can ConfigKey hold private keys longer than necessary, increasing the window for memory-based key extraction attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/safety_rules_config.rs] [Field: author] [PeerId collision] Can two validators have the same PeerId in SafetyRulesTestConfig, causing identity confusion in consensus? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/safety_rules_config.rs] [Field: author] [PeerId validation] Does the author PeerId get validated against the validator set, or can arbitrary PeerIds be used allowing unauthorized participation? (Critical)
